<!--Forms:
A form is a most common way for the user to communicate the info from the web browser to the server
form tag <form> used to create a html form this tag has several attributes and imp among them or the 
methods of action

Method: 
Ths attribute specifies how the entered data in form is sent to destination
Ther are two diff methods of sending info-s
1. post
2. Get

   Post Method: Information sent along with body
    get: info sent along with URL
Post: The data is invisible while sending
get: data is visible in sight address
post: It provides security
get: no security
post: It can send any no of characters
get: it send limited characters

User interface elements in form:
1. Label: This is used to display the text on the screen

Text field: 
It is an rectangular box which is used to take the input from the user. This can be created using input tag

Buttons:
HTML supports three types of buttons
1. Simple button
2. Submit button
3. Reset button

password field:
This is used to enter password by using input tag

Radio button:
This is used to select only one value at a time and can be done with input tag.

Checkbox:
This is used to select multiple values at a time

Combo box:
It is used ot select one value from multiple values and can be done by using select tag.

Text area:
This is the slghter text field but it has multiple rows and columns and it can be achieved by text area tag.

CSS: (Cascading style sheets)
CSS is used to format the layout of the webpage with CSS the developer can control the color, font, the size of the text, the spacing bw the elements, How the elements are positioned and laydown. CSS can be classified into three type of HTML documents
1. inline css
2. internal css
3. external css

Inline css:
An inline css is used to apply a unique style to a single html element.
An inline css uses the style attribute of the html element.

Internal css:
An internal css is used to define a style for a single html page.
an internal css is defined in the head section.

External css:
An external stylesheet is used to define the style of any html pages.



-->
